resources.string: How much do you know about Computer Science?

string-array.name: general_UTSA_Day_questions_array
string-array.item: What is the most basic unit of information in a computer?
What is the process of converting a high level programming language into machine code that the computer can understand?
Which of the following is NOT a part of a personal computer?
What does the acronym HTTP stand for?
What is the binary equivalent of the decimal number 10?
Which of these is NOT a programming language?
What is the symbol used to denote comments in a Python program?
What is the process of searching for and fixing errors in code called?
What is a common data structure used to store collections of items?
Which programming language is primarily used for web development?
What does the acronym CSS stand for?
Which manufacturer makes GPUs for personal computers?
Which of these is NOT a real operating system?
What is a number data type that can store fractional / decimal information?
What is a two-factor authentication (2FA) for?
What kind of attack fakes being a legitimate website to steal user information?
Which of these is NOT a way to wirelessly connect devices?
Who developed the first compiler (and the language, COBOL)?
What was Alan Turing known for?
What are Pandas and NumPy used for?
